name: Crowne Plaza Hotel Montreal Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night on a return from our winter holiday in Punta Cana. The shuttle was a bit delayed picking us up but drove us straight to the hotel efficiently.
reviews.title: One night stopover

reviews.text: The check in was smooth. Nice room on the 8th floor. Very small bathroom, but great bed and linens and soft pillows. Ordered room service for breakfast and food arrived still hot at a decent price.
reviews.title: Centrally located and nicely decorated

reviews.text: Good hotel and no problems with any staff. Recommend!
reviews.title: A wonderful end to a not so wonderful day.

reviews.text: A girlfriend and I stayed here recently for a girls weekend and we were very pleased.
reviews.title: Well run hotel

reviews.text: The hotel is located at the top of the 520 near Ikea and the 40 so it was easy to go anywhere in the West Island or Downtown.
reviews.title: Acceptable

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel because I was attending a wedding there. The actual bedroom was spacious (king room had room for a couch), but the bed wasn't very comfortable for me. Not sure what was going on with blanket/duvet, but it was hard to fall asleep with it (felt rough). The bathroom was tiny, and quite retro. Needs to be renovated. Again, let me re-iterate "tiny." Bring your own toiletries. The brand they had (not a brand I know) did not cut it for me.
reviews.title: Better options around the airport...

reviews.text: Check-in staff were nice enough, although there weren't enough behind the desk when I was checking in. I am disappointed by the lack of service when I told them that I had lost something in one of the banquet halls. The halls are probably under separate management, but I am disappointed that no one has called me back to this day (I even left my cell number).
reviews.title: Good for 1 or 2 nights only

reviews.text: I've stayed at other hotels by the airport, and there are plenty of better options. Note: the hotel is a 5 min drive from the airport, and about a 30 min drive from downtown Montreal.
reviews.title: Perfectly acceptable airport hotel

reviews.text: Happy travels!
reviews.title: Good pick if you stay one night on your way to somewhere else

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recently needed a reasonably priced hotel near the airport, so I chose what I thought would be a chain with a good name. Unfortunately, no matter how nice the people were, it is in desperate need of a makeover. The carpets and hallways were dirty, the elevators take forever to get up and down, the room not clean (paint, carpet, bathroom tiles), but certainly a layover place for travelers. That being said, it was reasonably priced and convenient to the airport with a free shuttle that left very early in the morning.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, better than other Crown Plaza Properties

reviews.text: Do not stay here! This hotel is absolutely terrible. The first time I stayed here I was having dinner with my coworkers in the downstairs restaurant, and we saw a rat run across the floor. As I have no choice where I stay for work, I found myself at this hotel just over a month later. I wanted to give it a second chance, thinking perhaps they took some care to the issue. I got into my hotel room, and there were black hairs all over the bath tub. Not going to kill me, but it's still disgusting. Slept the night, and woke up in the afternoon and was sitting on my bed watching tv. I got a little bit of an wary feeling, looked down beside my bed and there was a MOUSE! Filthy! I wanted to vomit. I talked to other colleagues who also found rodents in their rooms. Don't waste your money staying here and risk getting sick.
reviews.title: Rodent infested!

reviews.text: Spend one night was upgraded to executive floor, room is clean.
reviews.title: Nice hotel overall

reviews.text: Coffee shop waiter was impressive, asked if I want toast white or whole wheat, muffin etc.
reviews.title: Will never stay there again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Usually for buffet breakfast you choose your own and waiter just refill your coffee.
reviews.title: Great airport hotel! Excellent value deal on hotwire

reviews.text: Will return to this hotel for sure.
reviews.title: Very noisy hotel

reviews.text: I stayed here for work, and given that I didn't pay for my stay and still feel the need to complain, must show how disappointed I was with the service I received.
reviews.title: Find somewhere else!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At first I thought everything was going to be okay - my room looked clean, and it was a decent size. Then I went into the shower and found a hair on the shower head. My colleague who was staying in a different room found a dirty towel in her bathroom, hanging on the door. In the bed, I found a couple of hairs as well - and a couple in the pillow under the case which was open on one end.
reviews.title: Abysmal in every way. Past its use by date

reviews.text: Then came time to sleep - at 330 AM my sleep was disturbed by someone staying in the hotel who started banging on a neighbour's door. It took security forever to do anything. Never mind the fact that they started cleaning up the rooms around 630 am and with paper thin walls, the banging did nothing but keep me up.
reviews.title: Nothing special but satisfactory

reviews.text: I ordered room service for breakfast the following morning, and was told it would be ready soon. Having waited at least 40 minutes I called back asking how long it would still be. I was told it would be there soon and was then hung up on. She called back a minute later to tell me it'd be there in about 5 minutes - guess she realized her job was on the line.
reviews.title: Recommended place for a family reunion

reviews.text: For what it's worth, I did use the gym, which was pretty decent. But overall, I would not recommend staying here. If for some reason you do stay here and take a cab, don't tell the cab driver the hotel is near the airport (despite the hotel's name), as they'll drive you right to the airport and blame you for misdirection.
reviews.title: Beware: noise, noise and more noise

description: Welcome to an Exemplary New Montreal Airport Hotel The recently renovated Crowne Plaza Montreal Airport Hotel welcomes you to our distinguished business hotel near Pierre Elliott Trudeau Intl Airport (YUL). From the free airport shuttle to the Quiet Zone floors, corporate guests appreciate our Montreal accommodations. Business guests lodging in our Montreal airport hotel appreciate our experience and location. The Montreal airport is just five km from our hotel. We have the largest convention centre in the Montreal Airport area and can accommodate up to 1,350 people with free parking. In addition, you'll have free high-speed, wireless Internet access and a business center along with our professional staff to assist you. Our Montreal Airport hotel's location is ideal for leisure guests. You can easily enjoy the shopping on Sherbrook Street or downtown Montreal's attractions which are only 10 miles from the hotel. While lodging in our Montreal Airport hotel our guest enjoy the many relaxing amenities we offer like our indoor pool with a 120-foot water-slide, an invigorating sauna and the 24-hour fitness center. Our newly renovated rooms and suites offer you unparalleled accommodations in our Montreal hotel. You'll enjoy plasma TVs and CD clock radios as well as our Sleep Advantage Program amenities. You can dine on fine Italian cuisine or relax in our Connexion lounge. See why our hotel in Montreal is the Place to Meet.
